quotes.quote: And the tear that is wiped with a little address, May be follow'd perhaps by a smile.
A tear is made of 1% water and 99% feelings.
Every tear of sorrow sown by the righteous, springs up a pearl.
The tears stream down my cheeks from my unblinking eyes. What makes me weep so? There is nothing saddening here. Perhaps it is liquefied brain.
More tears are shed over answered prayers than unanswered ones.
Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
Tears are the safety-valves of the heart, when too much pressure is laid on.
Every tear from every eye Becomes a babe in eternity.
Tears do not burn except in solitude.
A tear that runs down a believer's cheek is more beneficial than a thousand raindrops on the earth.
A tear today is an investment in a laugh tomorrow.
Tears hinder sorrow from becoming despair.
In every tear there is a melting sorrow, in every laughter a flaming joy.
And the tear that we shed, though in secret it rolls, Shall long keep his memory green in our souls.
Tears are the silent language of grief.
The tears of those repenting are the wine of angels.
Tears may soothe the wounds they cannot heal.
Let tears flow of their own accord: their flowing is not inconsistent with inward peace and harmony.
Tears are a good alterative, but a poor diet.
Our tears fatten upon our memories of joy.
Tears are the natural penalties of pleasure. It is a law that we should pay for all that we enjoy.
For every laugh, there should be a tear.
Tears are the badges of sorrow.
We cannot tear out a single page of our life, but we can throw the whole book in the fire.
More tears are shed in playhouses than in churches.
Let your tears come. Let them water your soul.
Every tear of sorrow sown by the righteous springs up a pearl.
Tears are words the heart can't express.
The tears of the world are a constant quantity. For each one who begins to weep somewhere else another stops. The same is true of the laugh.
